Sentencas: In this study, dense YSZ (d_YSZ)-Ni/YSZ-porous YSZ (p_YSZ) double-layer anode structures were prepared by the tape casting-lamination-co-sintering (TLC) method to improve the stability of the cells due to the cracking reaction of methane.
Titulo: The investigation of active Ni/YSZ interlayer for Cu-based direct-methane solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Cu was infiltrated into all cells as an electronic conductive material.
Titulo: The investigation of active Ni/YSZ interlayer for Cu-based direct-methane solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The effect of CeO2 and SDC (samarium-doped ceria) loadings were also investigated.
Titulo: The investigation of active Ni/YSZ interlayer for Cu-based direct-methane solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Stable operation was obtained by using a Ni-interlayered Cu-based anode structure for dry methane fuel at 800 degrees C for 72 h.
Titulo: The investigation of active Ni/YSZ interlayer for Cu-based direct-methane solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: No carbonization was observed after the addition of Cu to the cell.
Titulo: The investigation of active Ni/YSZ interlayer for Cu-based direct-methane solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: An interesting finding was that a highly loaded secondary material (CeO2 and SDC) leads to a regional break of the electronic conduction network, which decreases the number of active TPB regions.
Titulo: The investigation of active Ni/YSZ interlayer for Cu-based direct-methane solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Therefore, carbonization occurred inside the cell in the Ni-containing interlayer zone.
Titulo: The investigation of active Ni/YSZ interlayer for Cu-based direct-methane solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: At the end of 72 h of cell operation, carbonization was observed inside the Ni-containing and Ni-free regions in the SDC-containing cell.
Titulo: The investigation of active Ni/YSZ interlayer for Cu-based direct-methane solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In addition to conducting cell tests, the behavior of powder SDC was studied under a dry methane environment by temperature-programmed surface reaction (TPR) and temperature-programmed oxidation (TPO) analysis.
Titulo: The investigation of active Ni/YSZ interlayer for Cu-based direct-methane solid oxide fuel cells
